section.title: Overview
section.para: The pua_usrloc is the connector between usrloc and pua modules. It creates the environment to send PUBLISH requests for user location records, on specific events (e.g., when new record is added in usrloc, a PUBLISH with status open (online) is issued; when expires, it sends closed (offline)).
Using this module, phones which have no support for presence can be seen as online/offline.

section.title: &osips; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
usrloc.
pua.

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &osips; with this module loaded:
libxml.

section.title: default_domain (str)
section.para: The default domain to use when constructing the presentity uri if it is missing from recorded aor.

section.title: entity_prefix (str)
section.para: The prefix when construstructing entity attribute to be added to presence node in xml pidf. (ex: pres:user@domain ).

section.title: presence_server (str)
section.para: The the address of the presence server. If set, it will be used as outbound proxy when sending PUBLISH requests.
The function is used to mark REGISTER requests that have to issue a PUBLISH. The PUBLISH is issued when REGISTER is saved in location table.
